item.title: Ex-Chinese Room Head Says Bloodlines 2 Shouldn't Have Been Called Bloodlines 2
item.content:encoded:
The Chinese Room co-founder and former creative director Dan Pinchbeck has expressed his regret that Bloodlines 2 wasn't called something different, suggesting that his studio felt the game wouldn't serve as a true sequel to the 2004 cult classic.

In an interview with The Goth Boss Podcast's Cat Burton (via ResetEra user doops), Pinchbeck says that he and a former producer at Bloodlines 2 studio Paradox would hold planning sessions for how to get the producers "to not call it Bloodlines 2".

He says that trying to recreate the "magic" of the original Bloodlines is "wrongheaded" in the modern environment, because the finished product wouldn't make anyone happy; fans of the original would be disappointed, and new players would get a "flawed game that was built too fast and with not enough money".

Pinchbeck reckons that it wasn't possible for The Chinese Room to make a true Bloodlines 2 because the studio had neither the time nor the money to do so; instead, he says his studio approached development from a perspective of what could be done with what it had available.

The result of that was, according to Pinchbeck, something that wasn't Bloodlines 2, nor was it an open-world RPG like Skyrim. Instead, it was something closer to Dishonored, a "tightly focused and true to the mythos" game that, nonetheless, wasn't a Bloodlines sequel.

Judging by the critical and fan reception to Bloodlines 2, Pinchbeck is right; most people don't really seem to view it as a proper successor to Troika's flawed-but-fun 2004 RPG. Perhaps a change of name might have been a good idea on that front.

Still, even if Bloodlines 2 isn't what it should be, it's perhaps a miracle that the game was released at all, given its lengthy history of delays, developer changes, and slightly sketchy monetization practices.

If you'd like to check out what Paradox and The Chinese Room ended up making, then Bloodlines 2 is available right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: 2025 Holiday Tabletop and Board Game Gift Guide
item.content:encoded:
The world of tabletop is booming with a ton of board games, role playing games, and trading card games seeing wild success. Here's a gift guide to find something for a friend or family member.

We'll have links below to purchase these items, but we also highly recommend checking this tool for your own local game shop to buy from them if possible.

Dungeons & Dragons Holiday Gift Guide

Dungeons & Dragons - Starter Set: Heroes of The Borderlands

There is nothing better to buy for someone that wants to get into Dungeons & Dragons with some friends or family than the Heroes of the Borderlands Starter Set. It comes with everything a brand new player and DM will need to get started playing the game. It's the perfect gift for someone that's been curious to give the game a try.

Our review goes into more detail.

Amazon

Dungeons & Dragons Stranger Things: Welcome to The Hellfire Club Adventure Game

For many, D&D caught their eye when Stranger Things came out. If you're a fan of the show, this lets you play as the D&D heroes the characters of the show actually play as. This is great for people new to D&D, with a lot of the same things as the Starter Set above. But, it's also a good time for D&D veterans who want some Stranger Things flavor.

Our review goes into more detail.

Amazon

Dungeons & Dragons 2024 Dungeon Master's Guide

Check our review for more specific information, but if you have anyone you know that's interested in becoming a DM for Dungeons & Dragons, this is THE book to get. It has all of the information they'll need to get going and is considered one of the core rulebooks of the game. The starter sets may be a better option for someone just dipping their toes, but this is great for someone that's ready to jump in fully. 

Amazon

Dungeons & Dragons 2024 Player's Handbook

If you already have the 2014 Player's Handbook and some of the expansions released later, this probably isn't needed. And if someone in the player group has one already, you probably don't need one of your own. But, this is still one of the "core" books for D&D that includes all of the nitty gritty details to play the game. Everything a player would need to know.

Our review goes into more detail.

Amazon

Dungeons & Dragons 2024 Monster Manual

This is the final core book that would flesh out just about everything anyone would need to know to play as expansive a game of D&D as they would want. It details all of the most popular monsters in D&D, how to make a monster and use them, and everything else. With the updated layout that is easier to use, this is a great pick up for a veteran D&D fan who may not have sprung for the newer manual yet.

Our review goes into more detail.

Amazon

Magic: The Gathering Holiday Gift Guide

Note: The cards market is crazy right now and the Collector Boosters in particular are selling massively higher than their retail price currently.

Play Boosters - These are the standard packs that can have nearly any card in the set in it.

Avatar: The Last Airbender - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)
Spider-Man - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)
Edge of Eternities - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)
Final Fantasy - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)

Jumpstart Boosters - These are packs that have set cards inside that are designed to work well together in a deck someone can put together.

Avatar: The Last Airbender - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)

Collector Boosters - These include special art variant cards only found in this type of pack in any given set. They include the most valuable, rarest versions of Magic cards.

Avatar: The Last Airbender - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)
Spider-Man - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)
Edge of Eternities - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)
Final Fantasy - Amazon | TCGPlayer (Single - Box)

Magic: The Gathering  Avatar: The Last Airbender Beginner Box 

This box is a great gift for someone that both loves Avatar and has wanted to give Magic: The Gathering a try. It has premade decks and a lot of helpful tools to get the hang of the game. It's perfect for those new to card games as well.

Amazon | TCGPlayer

Magic: The Gathering Foundations - Beginner Box

This is similar to the above but just older at this point and harder to find at its retail price. The set comes with a lot of staple Magic cards that you're likely to run across if you start playing other people. It's a great entry point to learn as well.

Amazon | TCGPlayer

Final Fantasy Commander Decks

Commander is a format to play Magic and is currently the most popular in the community. They sell some premade decks that let you play right away, and the Final Fantasy decks are all great options to start.

Revival Trance (FF6) - Amazon | TCGPlayer
Limit Break (FF7) - Amazon | TCGPlayer
Counter Blitz (FF10) - Amazon | TCGPlayer
Scions & Spellcraft (FF14) - Amazon | TCGPlayer

Final Fantasy Scene Boxes

Scene boxes are a set of six cards that depict one overall larger piece of art that you can see when you orient the cards together. These have yet to be released at publication and will all have cards brand new to Magic. They also include three play boosters.

FF1 Garland at the Chaos Shrine - Amazon | TCGPlayer
FF8 Children of Fate - Amazon | TCGPlayer
FF9 The Sege of Alexandria - Amazon | TCGPlayer
FF15 Camp Comrades - Amazon | TCGPlayer

Magic: The Gathering—Final Fantasy Chocobo Bundle

For Final Fantasy fans, this is the hot item for the holidays. It is a bundle that comes with 10 play boosters but also special Chocobo cards. The price is pretty hefty due to how desirable it is, however.

Amazon | TCGPlayer

Riftbound Holiday Gift Guide

This is a brand new TCG that has got popular quite quickly. It's based on the extremely popular video game series League of Legends.

Origins Booster Packs - Single | Box

Origins - Proving Grounds Box Set

This is the best box set to get someone if they're starting the game. They can jump in and play right away. Unfortunately, at least right now, everyone seems to know that and it's priced quite high.

TCGPlayer

Origins Champion Decks

There are also three premade decks ready to go to jump right in and play.

Lee Sin Champion Deck - TCGPlayer
Jinx Champion Deck  - TCGPlayer
Viktor Champion Deck - TCGPlayer

Disney Lorcana Holiday Gift Guide

Disney Lorcana is a competitive and collectible card game based on Disney properties. The game is well-designed (our Tabletop Game of the Year in 2023) that is great for veterans and newcomers. The Disney characters make it a great entry game for kids, too.

Booster Packs

Whispers in the Well - Amazon | TCGPlayer Single - Box
Fabled - Amazon | TCGPlayer Single - Box

Illumineer's Trove

These come with 8 booster packs, counters, and dice as well as coming in a nice box with dividers to store cards.

Whispers in the Well - Amazon | TCGPlayer
Fabled - Amazon | TCGPlayer 

Disney Lorcana Starter Decks

Every new set of cards comes with a few starter decks. Each are a great way to have a premade deck that is ready to play.

Whispers in the Well Sapphire & Steel - Amazon | TCGPlayer 
Whispers in the Well Amber & Emerald - Amazon | TCGPlayer 
Fabled Emerald & Ruby - Amazon | TCGPlayer
Fabled Amber & Sapphire - Amazon | TCGPlayer

Console Wars

A quick card game about building a video game empire, this is a great game that can be set up and played immediately. For fans of humorous card games and video games, this is great for everyone.

Learn more from our review.

Amazon

Marvel Multiverse RPG: Escape From Planet Hulk Starter Set

This is a starter set for the Marvel Multiverse RPG, which is like Dungeons & Dragons set in the Marvel world. Play as an interact with the heroes you know and love. A great starter set.

Learn more from our review.

Amazon

Heroscape Age of Annihilation Master Set

This is a big set all about having huge epic fantasy battles featuring all kinds of creatures. This is more akin to a wargaming expierence than anything, so it may be a bit much for those that are new to boardgames. That said, if you want a great introduction to battling miniatures, this is it.

Learn more from our review.

Amazon

Fromage

Fromage is a delightful game about making cheese. You compete with others to see who can be the best cheesmonger around. It's well-designed and very satisfying to play.

Learn more from our review.

Amazon

Maladum 

This is a huge board game that wants to immerse you in its world as much as possible. Because of that, the setup can be quite the chore to get a game session going. However, once everything is up, it's exciting and easy to lose yourself in playing.

Learn more from our review.

Amazon

Andrew is the Editor in Chief at TechRaptor. Conned into a love of gaming by Nintendo at a young age, Andrew has been chasing the dragon spawned by Super… More about Andrew
